stem: The patient's arterial line is in place and connected to a continuous flush system, which is maintained at 300 mmHg. Review the client data, then complete each sentence below by selecting the most appropriate option from the drop-down list.
references: AACN Procedure Manual for High Acuity, Progressive, and Critical Care, 7th Edition
Urden, L. D., Stacy, K. M., & Lough, M. E. (2022). Critical Care Nursing: Diagnosis and Management. Mosby.

rationale.correct: Arterial line waveforms provide continuous blood pressure monitoring. A dampened waveform indicates decreased accuracy and reliability of the readings. Possible causes include a kinked catheter, air bubbles, or a clot at the catheter tip. A MAP of 60 mmHg is generally required to perfuse vital organs. An elevated SVR increases afterload, which increases the workload of the heart.
clinicalPearls: Maintaining the integrity of an arterial line is crucial for accurate hemodynamic monitoring. Always assess the waveform, catheter site, and system connections. Ensure proper zeroing and leveling of the transducer.

itemContext.SBAR: S: Ms. Rodriguez is a 68-year-old female admitted for pneumonia, now with acute respiratory distress. B: History of hypertension, COPD. Admitted 3 days ago. Treated with antibiotics and bronchodilators. A: 07:00: Patient agitated, increased work of breathing. HR 120, BP 90/60 (MAP 67), RR 32, SpO2 88% on 6L NC. ABG: pH 7.32, PaCO2 55, PaO2 60, HCO3 26. Arterial line and CVP line placed. Continuous infusions started per orders. 07:15: Noted arterial line waveform dampened. Blood pressure reading remains 90/60. R: Assess arterial line patency and troubleshoot any potential issues. Titrate vasopressors per protocol to maintain MAP >65 mmHg. Consider further intervention for respiratory distress.
itemContext.Labs: ABG (07:00): pH 7.32, PaCO2 55 mmHg, PaO2 60 mmHg, HCO3 26 mEq/L; WBC 14,000/mm3
itemContext.Vitals: 06:00: HR 110, BP 110/70, RR 24, SpO2 92% on 3L NC; 07:00: HR 120, BP 90/60 (MAP 67), RR 32, SpO2 88% on 6L NC; CVP: 3 mmHg
itemContext.Radiology: Chest X-ray: Bilateral infiltrates consistent with pneumonia.
itemContext.MAR: Ceftriaxone 1g IV q24h; Albuterol/Ipratropium nebulizer q4h PRN; Norepinephrine infusion (titrate to MAP >65 mmHg); Pantoprazole 40mg IV daily
